sugar.advice: Limit sugar intake to reduce risk of obesity, diabetes, and heart disease.

salt.advice: Excess salt may lead to high blood pressure and cardiovascular diseases.

cholesterol.advice: High cholesterol intake increases the risk of heart disease.

saturated fat.advice: Too much saturated fat can raise LDL cholesterol and heart disease risk.

trans fat.advice: Trans fats are harmful and should be avoided entirely.

total fat.advice: High total fat may contribute to weight gain and heart issues.

carbohydrate.advice: Monitor carbs to avoid weight gain and blood sugar spikes.

protein.advice: Excess protein intake may burden kidneys in some individuals.

fiber.advice: Less than 25g of fiber may indicate low dietary fiber intake.

calories.advice: Exceeding daily calorie needs may result in weight gain.
